Reviews.Title: “Perfect location close to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: bosskunga
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean and friendly.rooms serviced daily. Great value location close to many main attractions within the city. Perfect location for walking to lots of key sites. Highly recommended as well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: Crooked Nose
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly agree with the most recent reviews and as a frequent visitor to Barcelona can commend Hotel Paral-lel on price,value for money and location.The staff are particularly helpful and friendly and complimentary internet in the lobby is much appreciated.The Paral-lel is surrounded by eating places including one of Barcelona's most celebrated tapas locations - Quimet & Quimet and the Metro is just yards away. It will be my 1st choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “weekend in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: joy a
Reviews.Content: everything you needed for a weekend break - right in centre of city.Clean rooms comfortable; good size bathroom with shower; hardryer in bathroom; personal safe; very pleasant helpful staff;reasonably priced; lovely continental breakfast with loads of choice and plenty to keep you going till the evening meal. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for a great time in great city”
Reviews.Author: Sapat69
Reviews.Content: Hotel and the service is great. Free Internet. Near the downtown. Good connections to publice transportation. I will stay here anytime. With L 2 to downtown. Fast bus to the airport. Buy a one week metro ticket. There are lot of good pubs around the paral lel. ....."............................................

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, nice location and clean”
Reviews.Author: nomad1987
Reviews.Content: Was visiting from the US and I must say I had 0 complaints about the place. The room was exactly as pictured: the beds were comfortable , the shower was extremely good and the bathroom was clean and modern. Both nights I stayed out after 2 am and I felt extremely safe coming back home alone or with friends and saw several locals doing the same. Extremely close La Rambla and subway station. And friendly staff , so I feel I got good value for the money I paid (approx. 65 euros)

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lewis_England_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a football break package and would not probably have been our first choice. For a two star hotel the Paral lel is fine. Friendly helpfull staff. Clean modern and functional bedrooms, no frills but everything you need for a short stay. Nice bathrooms, very good shower. Not a bad location, about 15 minutes walk from the Ramblas and Gothic quarter. Breakfast buffet was basic but all tasted good and filled the gap! Watch the pick pockets late at night! Would stay there again if on a budget break and would recommend to others on the same basis.

Reviews.Title: “The best 2 star hotel I stayed in”
Reviews.Author: amrotefa
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Excellent location near to metro station & La Rambla -Modern clean rooms & bathrooms with good space -Excellent room rates Cons: -Walls are very thin, too much noise from outside or from next door rooms Overall its an excellent bargain. Just make sure not to stay in rooms near elevator or exits. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: crobi1
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for the price. Good location, rooms were spotless and we had no trouble with noise on the third floor. staff were helpful and I had no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “centered, good price and very clean”
Reviews.Author: lillishor
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in center and clean; the pther person I was with wanted something cheaper than 50 euro/person/night and if possible, to be able to walk to the beach. I liked because it was near a very important avenue, on a street between KFC and Burger King; also in the neighborhood there was a Lidl store; I liked that the room was very clean - there was a daily cleaning routine and changing of sheets & towels was also made every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: HappyHols1812
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the triple room for 4 nights. For the money, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and spacious, and also very quiet at night. There was some building work going on in the hotel but this did not disturb us. My only criticism would be that the shower curtain did not go all the way round the shower which meant it was quite easy to get the bathroom floor very wet. I also thought that the hotel could provide hairdryers in the room. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting cheap accommodation in a central location in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “No sense of customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ianwill
Reviews.Content: The upgrading of rooms led to so much noise it became unbearable to relax

Reviews.Title: “Just the right distance from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: mike_walker40
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Paral-el easily, just round the corner from the metro and were surprised that we could have a gentle stroll to the Rambla in about 10-15mins, it must have been less than a mile. The cafes near the hotel were really cheap but the area had a real buzz of locals rather than tourists - which is of course what we tourists want - to not be near loads of tourists! We felt perfectly safe, even late at night and every one was really friendly. The hotel was clean and tidy - no complaints at all. Some other reviews have mentioned thin walls but I think this is a symptom of not having carpets - everything is a lot more echoy. However we didn't find this a problem at all. Single beds pushed together could be a problem as if you rolled into the middle you might disappear down the gap as the beds slid easily on the tiled floor. All in all a good hotel for the money (we paid 66.10 euros a night).

Reviews.Title: “clean and good price/location”
Reviews.Author: dell3581
Reviews.Content: hotel is in the old city and the surrounding are quite "pictoresque". 5 min from metro station and about 10 min walk to Ramblas. rooms have been recently renewed and were clean and comfortable. hotel personnel can speak English. Only bad surprise was that breakfast was not included and we didn't know and had to pay 20 EUR more per day but that was fault of the internet portal venere.com which didn't stated it clearly as it usually does. would recommend it for a trip to barcelona with modest budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for AWESOME location”
Reviews.Author: Rammiegirl
Reviews.Content: PROS - very easy to find - easy access to Las Ramblas - easy access to the Metro - very clean - late night eats if you get into the city late - SAFE IN ROOM - free wireless - helpful concierge/front desk - clean - close to other attractions like Musee National and Poble Espanol. CONS: - in double rooms, there are only two twin beds. Not ideal for couples. Not the softest but you get what you sign up for. - tucked in a side street off the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Great two star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dejoca
Reviews.Content: We had no problem finding the hotel. The directions given in the hotel's website were very good. The hotel is located in a central avenue in Barcelona, not far from Las Ramblas or Plaça d'Espanya. The "metro" station is near the hotel and not hard to find. There are also some bus connections available. Next to the hotel you can find a Burger King and a KFC, as well as several cafés and restaurants. There are some supermarkets and convenience stores nearby (LIDL is at a five minute distance from the hotel, in case you want to buy some groceries). The people working at the reception as well as the cleaning ladies were very nice. They were very helpful whenever needed, and prompt to answer any request we might have. The bedroom was nice, well furnitured, with all the basics you might need. The safe was a plus, in case you want to save something valuable. There was a LCD TV, which seems to have replaced the old TV sets you see in some of the old pictures from the hotel. There is cable TV, though almost every TV channel is either Spanish or dubbed into the Spanish language, which is a big downer and a disappointment if you understand nothing of the language. Needless to say the TV will be of no use unless you know Spanish or Catalan. The alternative is to listen to music in one of the two TV music channels or watch the news channels (the only couple of channels in English that were not dubbed). When the reservation was made it was said that the bathroom had shower and bathtub facilities. There was a shower, but no tub. The bathroom is very nice though. It was obvious they had had recent renovation work done. One of the things that was not so good was the fact that renovation was being done in other rooms, especially in the morning (when people are supposed to be sleeping). The hotel had notes apologizing for the inconvenience, which was very thoughtful of them, but still, it would have been nice to know of it before we got there. Plus, renovating during a low season would probably be a better option (but of course we have o idea what was behind the decision to do it at that precise moment). The room was always clean, the cleaning ladies did a good job making sure everything looked nice and neat. The hotel faces either the small street or the building behind it, so there is nothing amazing about that. But then again, you are not paying a five star hotel with a great view over the ocean. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, so I have no comments on that. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a friend. It's a great two star hotel, nicely located, clean, with a nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: haehnchenwald
Reviews.Content: I came here with my mate while travelling around Europe and we were very impressed by the hotel. The location is off one of the biggest streets in Barcelona centre and is in very close proximity to Paral.lel metro stop - from there the centre of the city is only 5-10 minutes maximum. There are also plenty of places to eat in terms of fast food and there is a supermarket around 5 minutes walk away. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly with any requests that we had. The room was very nice and kept clean daily - definitely a lot better than I expected from a two-star hotel. Free wi-fi went down a treat as well. Definitely the best two-star hotel I've been in.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again..”
Reviews.Author: lucia2684
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block away from the metro. The rooms are small but very clean, but if you are in Barcelona you probably wont be spending to much time at the hotel. There is a lot to do there. The service was good and you have lots of restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Bear73
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located for the metro, and pretty easy to get to from the airport (take Renfe to Sants Estacio and then it's about 3 stops on L2) We had two rooms, one on the 5th floor and one on the 1st. The room on the 5th floor was quiet and reasonably spacious. The room on the 1st floor was overlooking the main road outside with a news kiosk outside so was very noisy all night, however it was clean and comfortable. We didn't have breakfast there, but there are plenty of other places nearby where you can get better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap clean & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: joancollins69
Reviews.Content: First night on 4 th floor where renovations were occurring during business hours but shifted the night after to first floor. Great location to metro but I walked every where. The area is reported to be dodgy but I felt safe but remained alert but not to the point of paranoia. Rooms very clean with twin single beds water pressure great as was wifi. Breakfast more then ample with heaps of sweet treats. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what I needed”
Reviews.Author: MF1233
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers have mentioned... this is a fine property. Not extravagant, but not a dump either. Staff were very polite and were kind enough to speak with me in English when I ran out of words in Spanish. I was not expected to leave my key behind whenever I left -- perhaps I was not following the policy, but nobody on staff ever said that there was that policy or asked me to hand in my key when I was exiting. Did not partake in the breakfast buffet -- there is a supermarket a few blocks up the road, I preferred to grab and go. Burger King and KFC at the intersection in a pinch. Proximity to Metro was great -- L2, L3, and Funicular train to Montjuic especially. Moltes gràcies!

Reviews.Title: “Lowish price but expect no frills”
Reviews.Author: Seasondtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a cheap place, but a rather basic one. Location is so and so, not far from a lot of interesting places but not very closeby either. The room was fairly quiet though, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid-priced hotel, conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: chugzy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Paral.lel is close to the Paral.lel metro station, a quick 2-3 stops from the heart of the action at Placa Catalunya. The Paral.lel metro station also houses the funicular to Mount Juic, and is on the line to/from Barcelona Sants station. They had a great breakfast buffet, comfortable rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, it could be better”
Reviews.Author: manueltorres
Reviews.Content: The hotel was at a great, safe location, within a few steps of 2 Metro stations, it has a parkinglot right on front of it for €30 a day, the only employee I sow was at the reception we didnt get a welcome or a thank you or anything like that, but he dint treat us bad eather can't complaint, free wifi but it didn't always worked well, the restrooms where clean but need a renovation. The only downside of the hotel was the weird nasty smell and the hard beds but it was a good price.....

Reviews.Title: “Overall, yes, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ForceTranquille
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day stay at the Parallel hotel, and I have to say that should I return to Barcelona in the future, i would definitely be likely to book at this hotel. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are indeed on the smaller side, but on holiday how much time do you spend in your room, you're out doing things like sightseeing and eating are you not. I'd say the best thing is probably the location, close to Metro lines 2 & 3, the actual parallel stop is about 3 minutes away on foot, and this opens up the vast majority of the city for the major sights, many of which happen to have a stop on lines 2 & 3. For example, the bottom end of La Rambla is one stop down line 3, you get off at Drassanes. The rooms are immaculately clean, everything works, and the staff are efficient. I can't comment on the breakfast as I eat out. Traffic noise is present, but later at night not too intrusive, unless you're a really light sleeper in which case I'd say look elsewhere. Another large plus is the realistic and reasonable price, which in an expensive city like Barca has to be a consideration. There are plenty of restaurants within a sensible walking distance, so eating is easy. The only thing I would advise you of is their policy regarding room keys, you hand it in each time you leave the hotel and collect it on the way in, asking for room xxx number. There was no particular policy in place that i could see confirming the identity of the person asking for the key, and with the changes of staff by night and day in theory someone random could obtain a key for anyone's room. It didn't bother me that much, but I am careful to take anything of value or importance with me and keep it on my person in a zipped pocket, as long as you're sensible, I consider the likelihood of being mugged less probable than having something taken from the room. There is a safe in the room anyway, so valuables can be kept locked away if necessary. Don't let this put you off, just be aware of it and ask yourself if you're happy with it. Anyway, as I say, I would return here without hesitation, the pluses are greater than the negatives, and Barcelona is such a fabulous city that using this hotel would help to enhance your experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: davecave
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastically easy hotel to find, just a 5 min or less walk from Parallel Metro stop, which is just 2 stops from Las Ramblas. The hotel was clean and friendly. The staff gave us a map, and all the touristy type things you may want to do could be found on info boards and leaflets in the lobby. The breakfast was adequate, not a huge array of choice, but more than enough to see you through until lunchtime. There are an abundance of theatres on this stretch of road, so if that's your thing you're in the right area. There are some great little authentic spanish cafes too, selling real spanish tapas and beer at real prices. To be honest when you're in Barcelona you don't really want to spend too much ime in your hotel anyway. Make sure you visit Las Ramblas, from where you can connect relatively effortlessly to all the major sights i.e. La Sagradia Familia, Guell Park, Port Vell, Gaudi House, Dali Museum etc etc etc. there is a million things to do here, and on top of all that it's by the sea. I would definitely recommend flying to and from BCN Airport itself rather than from other airports outside of the city itself, as I have done this before and it really is just time wasted. Love Barcelona, I've been 5 times now, and it's just great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay - great experience”
Reviews.Author: Mita8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and loved every bit of it. The location of the hotel is superb. Metro station is 2 mins walk only and there are lots of eating joints nearby. The staff was very pleasing and helpful. The room was clean and the wash room was spacious and clean. I cant comment about the food there as we had all our meals outside. As a whole our stay was very pleasant. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Right up my street”
Reviews.Author: prophet26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paral.lel over Christmas. It had a great uncluttered reception area, friendly reception staff, clean rooms, hot water always. We didn't bother with breakfast because we wanted lie-ins as we were exhausted in the run-up to Christmas but we found a great sandwich bar just down the street. We rarely return to hotels we have stayed in but we would return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CauLeo
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and they only have rooms with small old baths. When you took a bath all the room get wet. For old persons it is a real problem. My mother slipped in the small bath and hurt her knee.The staff didn`t help with anything. The rooms only have single beds. When we arrived they said they put us in a room with single beds because they didn`t want to put the family in separate levels. But we ask them to put us in room with a couple bed, even if in different levels. So the staff changed what was said ... they don`t have couple beds in the hotel .... The rooms are noisy with people walking all night long, talking and pulling their rolling bags on the floor.Besides that, the breakfast was in our room level. So, early in the morning you can hear people going to the breakfast talking to each other. We didn't opened the courtins because the view (an old building with clothes hanged outside the windows) was terrible. The taxi called by the hotel to take friends to the airport charged an extra price. To finish, on our last night, the staff said there was an extra room booked with our name, that we had to pay for it. It was a nasty situation.

Reviews.Title: “clean but thats about it.”
Reviews.Author: stokerej
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paral.lel for one night pre cruise. It is really clean but thats all I can say about it. The rooms are small and the beds are really uncomfortable and whilst the surrounding area is OK, there is not a lot going on. The TV didn't work and the free internet was broken as well. Wouldn't reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Non responsive from the hotel with all my emails inquiries regarding late check-in and delay due to pick pockets in France”
Reviews.Author: SexysuzyWong
Reviews.Content: Will not stay in this hotel, if because of the poor cancelatio policy. Hotel still bill me for 19 November for penalty due to an accident happened to me in the morning I was walking from my hotel in Nice, France to the Train station. Called hotel from France no one ever answer the phone. No one ever response to my emails regarding my reservation. Booking.com answered my inquries instead and indicated the hotel refused to just change my reservation to one day late and wanted to bill me for one night, 19 Nov, the day I couldn't arrive due to an accident and missed the train connection to Barcelona from France.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly.”
Reviews.Author: mozzadrella
Reviews.Content: I stayed their once in a single, and it was just fine. When I got a double, the bathroom stank of urine. It made the entire room rank. I brought it up to the front desk and the concierge seemed unsurprised. He said he would "do what he could." Nothing changed. Also, the bedside table was mysteriously oily. For $140/night?

Reviews.Title: “Decent accomodation for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kulda
Reviews.Content: I must agree with previous comments, that this hotel is better than what 2-star ranking may suggest. We stayed here 5 nights with my wife. The room was not much spacious but still enough if you only plan to sleep here. Twin Bed was comfy and big enough. We used minifridge, but did not turn on TV set neither the A/C during the whole stay as it we did not need it. All the furniture looked in good condition and also the bathroom. No rust or mold. The room was cleaned every day. The hotel is round the corner from a main street,but we did not hear any noise from the street at night. We could here our neighbour guests one night though. The hotel location is excelent, 100m from two metro lines and funicular to Montjuic. Or 5 minute walk to Rambla or Harbour. The only flaw was WiFi Internet which did not work first three days of our stay. The staff kept telling me that they were working to fix it, but it took them 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star hotel with big stars.”
Reviews.Author: TEKnudsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in September 2010 at hotel Paral-lel. The hotel is well located in the periphery of central Barcelona. In walking distance from La Rambla and Placa d’Espanya where you can take the airport bus and in the evening see the Font Màgica fountain. The furnishing of the room is simple with clinker on the floor, but there is an okay bed, minibar and safe. It is clean and well maintained. The sound insulation could be better. A sound from other rooms and especially the corridor penetrates easily. The breakfast is continental with no warm dishes. The staff speaks well English. It is a 2 star hotel. In my opinion it is 2 big stars and I will gladly use it again when traveling on a low budget.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: TonyJxx
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for someone looking for a place to sleep at night. There isn't much to it, but the Staff is extremely nice and helpful. We were out being tourists and eating nearly all of our time in Barcelona so this hotel served its purpose as a place to rest our heads, and nothing more. I'm not sure the hotel trusts the area since they encourage you to leave your key with the desk, but the area seemed safe, not really anything out of the ordinary compared to the rest of the city. One giant plus was its proximity to the Metro and it is within walking distance to Las Ramblas and the harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: IngTL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Paral.lel is very close to a metro station, numerous bus stops, multiple restaurants, and 2 large grocery stores. It is also within walking distance to La Rambla, with lots of little shops on your walk there. If you want to take public transportation, a 10-journey ticket is pretty cheap and will get you practically anywhere you want to go. The hotel has 1 computer with internet for guests to use, which was very handy for us. We stayed in a room by the restaurant so it was loud in the morning, but otherwise no other complaints. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place for good value”
Reviews.Author: kris073
Reviews.Content: strongly recommend if you are on budget, not used to be accomodatedin 5* stars hotel. Excellent location / walking distance to Rambla and harbour, a view meters far from metro station. Room was cleaned every day, safe in place, air-condition working properly.

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you have a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: camilamassumi
Reviews.Content: We did not expect too much from this hotel as it is a two star hotel. We found Barcelona the most expensive city in Spain, so if you have a tight budget for a trip (like we did), it will be suitable for you. The old building façade was under repair during our stay. Room / bathroom's furniture were old but clean. We stayed at a room right in front of the elevator's hall, so it was quite noisy. Receptionists were nice. Good point is that it was a 10 min walk to Las Ramblas and Metro Paral-lel was very near to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJG5
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel, we were looking for budget accommodation, and weren't disappointed here. Easy to get to from the airport, close to the harbour and places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Really good location right off the Metro and the staff were very helpful and friendly. You can't beat the value for Barcelona. It is a nice hotel with all the accomedations at a really good price. It's a bit noisy when people are out in the hallways. But the beds are comfy. Easy walk to the Rambla. And its in a cute neighborhood (Poble Sec) that you might not see otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: schizophrenic
Reviews.Content: The hotel was rather hard to find so be prepared. But the location is very strategic. It is near the metro line and a KFC. There are restaurants all around so food will not be a problem. I do not recall thin walls like what other reviewers said. However, during the summer, the room is hot even with a fan. Luckily, I am not in my room during the day as I spent my entire day travelling. Spent 4 nights in this hotel. All that I can say is, it was well worth the money paid. I would recommend this as a value for money hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay. Poor value.”
Reviews.Author: Zyonig
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel. I chose it for its central location but the positives end there. Very noisy, all sorts of crashing and banging going on all night and into the morning. Staff wandering into the room in the early morning. Grubby rooms, upstairs toilet dripping onto a plastic contraption above our bathroom roof (annoying all night). There was some hotel brochures from the chain in the room but they were torn and scribbled on (no excuse for not having replaced them). I expected better from this company, they have other hotels that ARE good, but this one is overpriced and unpleasant. One to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Average 2 star, i lost one of my hardrock cafe t-shirt !!!”
Reviews.Author: Dhine
Reviews.Content: Yes ladies and gentlemen its a 2 star hotel, reception is ok, prices are reasonable and ok, rooms are and they have comfortable beds and pillows, its very nice after a whole day of walking and exploring Barcelona. The location is at the back of Catalunya but Ave. Parallel has its own shops and restaurants so for us no prob. Rooms are not soundproof so its irratating. I lost my valued hardrock cafe t-shirt in our room ( its valued coz its a present from a friend of mine from Hardrock cafe New York). So I recommend to travelers! Dont hang anything in ur bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Clean & Good location”
Reviews.Author: roc0603
Reviews.Content: I picked the paral.lel based on my budget and it was actually pretty decent. Clean room (although very small), minibar (stocked & pay for whatever you used at end of visit), safety box in room, daily housekeeping, good size bathroom (w/ limited shelf space & very small shower/tub) and very clean w/ fresh towels daily. The only downside to the Paral.el is that if you traveling alone you'll be sleeping in a twin bed (not ideal for some) and the other issues is the noise in the morning. The doors aren't soundproof so in the morning hours you hear housekeeping cleaning, talking and slamming door; again not ideal if you looking to sleep in. Other then that the my stay here was good. Close to the Metro (1/2 a block), shops and dining in the area, in walking distance to the Ramblas and the Rambla Mar (w/ shopping, dining, and great views). The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Horrible Hotel of My Life”
Reviews.Author: ElTurco85
Reviews.Content: Lads, Do NOT go to this hotel,1st security problem,the area is really dangerous,that street. Hotel workers or some body else there stole my camera in the hotel and they charged 2 nights plus from my credit card!( I payed cash and they told me that they need my credit card only for reservation) Do NOT go to this hotel,it will be a big mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: LEGNAHCRA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise for the price and its position just two metro stops away from La Rambla area or if you like just a ten minute walk. Clean, quiet, free internet, fresh clean laundry every day. I cant find any fault with the premises. Friendly staff helped with any request. Good area and well placed to do your touring from. Watch where you buy in the La Rambla as we were charged 26 Euro in one spot outside a cafe for ONE drink! But this is not the norm as there are plent of cheap spots around especially in the Gothic area.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: kostasicebar
Reviews.Content: very good location next to metro and 10 minutes walking from la rambla.hotel is very clean,the room big enough and we could use internet for free.what else do we need for our stay?

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable, relatively close-in, good staff.”
Reviews.Author: DLeshus
Reviews.Content: Only about a half-block from the Metro station. Neighborhood is transitional--not bad in most spots, but follow your "street sense" while choosing your paths, especially if you're heading up the hill toward the park. Room was small but serviceable with a nice clean bathroom. My room was on the 5th floor and was relatively quiet and comfortable. Could have used some paint as the walls were pretty scuffed in the room. Other reviews have mentioned the smell, and my little room was no exception. Kind of funky. I think perhaps there was something going on in or around the refrigerator. Not drive-you-out-of-your-room bad, but one did notice it when walking in. Staff was nice, except for the night clerk, who was pretty tough on kicking folks off the PC in the lobby. Why the curfew on the internet? Old-fashioned leave-your-key arrangement, but in a hotel of this size, there's really no reason to be concerned...the staff knows who the guests are and won't hand your key to someone walking in off the street. Hey, it's a two-star hotel, and it certainly fits right in there. Could really be better with just a little work and attention to the details. Overall, not a bad base if you're not planning on spending time lounging around your hotel. And who in Barcelona would want to do that?

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: Geert-Hilde
Reviews.Content: Of course you realise when you book this hotel that you do not have to expect much luxury. But still, I payed 60 euro/night and for what the hotel offered, this was not cheap. Rooms are small, the bathroom is old and had a bad sewer smell, I had a small single bed with a very hard matras. But it was clean and the location is o.k., only one metrostop to the center of the city. If you are a bad sleeper, rooms on the side of the road can be very noisy. All in all I will not return to this place and look for an hotel with a better price/quality balance.

Reviews.Title: “fine, but security a big issue.”
Reviews.Author: e813
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in early September. The location is good - close to the Metro - and it's clean. We were also OK with the fact that the beds are hard as a rock and the walls are paper thin. We heard EVERYTHING on our floor from babies crying to partying at all hours of the night. The biggest issue we had though was security. You have to give your key to the front desk whenever you leave for the day, and upon returning, they just give you your key without asking for ID or any type of verification!! Anyone could have come in, said they were in room 303 and got our key. It's a very strange system, and we were NOT comfortable leaving our key at the desk. It would have been OK if we had to prove that we were staying at the hotel upon return, but no. We just had to say 303, which anyone could do. Also, the hotel gives you a card clearly saying that they are not responsible for items missing from your room. No kidding! Also, since we were only on the 3rd floor, we figured it was quicker to take the stairs. However, at more than a few occasions we found that the stairs, which were the emergency exits, were locked!! We did a 2 week tour of France and Spain, and this was the most expensive hotel we stayed in and the one we liked the least. We are fine with small, noisy rooms... it's Europe and we weren't there to stay in the hotels all day. But we at least like to know that our stuff will be there when we return!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, go with low expectations.”
Reviews.Author: foodcomesfirst
Reviews.Content: Nothing horribly wrong here, it's just very basic and kinda sad looking in the rooms. What happened was that I had booked three nights via hotwire at the H10 Marina for about $70 per night, but then I realized we were going to stay a 4th night in Barcelona but couldn't extend for the same rate at that hotel, so I thought: Okay. I will test hotwire. I will pick the hotel that I would have picked if I hadn't used Hotwire. So, for about the same price (or about $10 less per night, same ballpark) I picked this place based on price/location/reviews. Let's just say it there was NO comparison, we missed the H10 the minute we walked in the door here and even more when we got up to our musty, ugly little room. It wasn't awful, but it was not appealing. You feel like you are in a budget hotel, which you are. You have to leave your key at the front desk every time you leave the hotel. It's just kinda old fashioned and basic. The location is decent. It is near a metro stop. Funny thing was, from reading the reviews here and on venere, I thought that this hotel was very well situated and that the H10 marina was further out and would be less convenient to the city center. But actually, they were equidistant to the city center, just in different directions. This was west by a 10-15 minute walk to the center (I'm using the Gothic quarter /Picasso Museum as the epicenter) and the H10 was 10-15 min walk to the East of the center. So not much difference. This place has a computer that you can use for free internet in the lobby, thats a big plus. It's also near a famous tapas bar that was on my list Quimet & Quimet. But when we went there after a really busy sightseeing day, and I saw how crowded it was and there is no seating, I couldn't deal, I needed to sit and relax, so we ended up going to a different place to eat. (The Cafe L'Academia which was utterly fantastic). The air conditioning worked really well, is another plus. The shower had good pressure and didn't spill all over the bathroom,(my only real complaint at the h10). But the room had a bit of a musty smell and the bedding was not very comfortable. I could hear drunk people coming back late at night that woke me up. I didn't feel as safe in this hotel as the other, though it wasn't super sketchy or anything. Basically, if you NEED this price point and can't find a better deal, it will suffice. But if you are thinking "it looks pretty nice! Why pay more?" , I urge you to consider doing a bit more research, because it is not a room you will enjoy coming back to. You deserve, for your vacation, something a bit more plush :) if you are brave, check out Hotwire. I was ever so happy with that gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location and nice staff, but the smell ruined our stay.”
Reviews.Author: chueybb
Reviews.Content: While the front desk attendant was nice and the room itself was nicely furnished, there was one kiss of death for this hotel: The smell! Our first entrance into our room was greeted with a rather foul smell of vinegar or strong bleachlike detergents. The smell pervaded through our three day trip despite attempts to air out the room and blast A/C. Our request to change rooms the first night was denied due to the hotel being "full". The towels and bathroom were the worst smelling items in the room which leads me to believe it is some powerful but stinky cleaning detergent that they must use (which seems counter-productive, no?). Apart from the smell, the location was decent, about 5 min. from the nearest subway. The area was not great but definitely not unsafe, etc. I would not book again for fear of getting a similarly smelly room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with modern room in good location”
Reviews.Author: ViscountJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights (Tue to Fri) last June. The man at the reception was quite nice and spoke good English. Got a room on the fifth floor facing the back. It had two single beds right next to each other, a 13-inch tube TV with cable, good-sized closet with safe and floor-to-ceiling mirrors, and a nice bathroom with decent quality amenities. There's free wireless internet but could not get it to work the next two nights; used the PC in the lobby instead. Hotel is within 3-6 blocks of two L3 metro stations (Paral-lel and Poble Sec). There's a supermarket between the hotel and the Poble-Sec station. There are fast food and regular restaurants in the area. La Rambla, the waterfront, and Placa Espana are within walking distance (10-15 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean room and average service”
Reviews.Author: alwaysfly
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in early June with my friend for a 4 days holiday. The location is great and easy for you to go everywhere, metro L3 and Bus 24 terminal to go to parc guell. Nearby has so many restaurant for breakfast and great paella and sangria with very reasonable price. Room is pretty clean and has sufficient towels and other needed amenities. Service is ok, one of the reception was a bit slow but most of the staff are very friendly and patient. oh, they were a bit noisy in the corridor and i think they talk a bit loud but i guess it applies to all spanish ..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for city break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: KingDom74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during a trip to Barcelona last week. The rooms are basic but clean, staff friendly and always helpful. The hotel is pretty central and only a 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas and is reasonably priced when compared to other hotels around Barcelona. (You wouldn't think it was a 2 star hotel). If your looking for somewhere to stay and don't want to spend a fortune on accommodation then I'd recommend this place. The only down side is that they don't have a bar and the breakfast is not worth the money but apart from that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Base”
Reviews.Author: reedo5
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the EasyJet website due to price and location. Travelled to barcelona for the catalan derby and stayed for four night in a group of 6. Found the hotel clean, tidy and staff very friendly. Rooms are basic and clean so made the parellel an ideal base as we didnt spend any time in the hotel as we were out and about the city and at the game. Location is good about half way down the parallel with easy walking to mountjuic, la rambla, and port area. There is also a metro stop just around the corner from the hotel which as has a link the fenicular thats takes you to the olympic stadium complex. One little gem for the football fans out there, if you come out of the hotel turn right walk across the parellel and up towards the small market areas there is a football shop which you can see by its astro turf entrance. If you love la liga then you can buy everything in that shop!! As im in Barcelona alot for the football i will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Not brill but ok for value”
Reviews.Author: samsonsmummy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was basic, but the rooms were clean. No restaurant or bar. Ok if only using to sleep, but having said that the beds were very uncomfortable. Quite noisy even though the hotel was not fully booked. Our view from the window was not pleasant unless you like scruffy apartments with washing hanging out. But the staff were pleasant and the breakfast wasnt too bad. The district was a bit run down but was only a short walk down to the port. The pizza hut across the road is a thieves paradise! My sister had her bag stolen from there and their staff are very questionable! So I would not recommend eating there. But there is a great friendly bikers pub across the roadt though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not too expensive, clean enough and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Migrant
Reviews.Content: I didn't love the hotel, but I thought it was fine. Good location, nice enough staff and free internet. The cost seemed ok (not fantastic value) and seemed cheaper than other places around. I would recommend you stay here if you are after a no-fuss base. Not if you are after somewhere special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing staff, amazing location, amazing price”
Reviews.Author: tanlouis
Reviews.Content: Both my girlfriend and I loved the hotel, especially the staff. We were amazed that the hotel is only rated at 2 stars as we have stayed in 5 star hotels with worse service. The room we had was roomy, clean, and well kept. Highly highly highly recommended. Like really highly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad staff!”
Reviews.Author: devrimyo
Reviews.Content: Fine&clean rooms, fine location but untrained & quiet irresponsible staff, especially the recepsionist named Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Delgihted with hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexofMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect as first time in Barcelona but was met with friendly service, and a crisp clean modern room. Internet available in lobby, good location, no extra noise, and I even had a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “clean, basic room, great location”
Reviews.Author: jjones1974
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here last September. It was fabulously located and clean and no-frils. I say this is "Barcelona on a budge" for sure, but had all the basic ammenities. If you need somewhere located in the heart of the action that is clean, priced well then this is your place

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK”
Reviews.Author: travellingmatt72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in September while attending a conference in Barcelona. The hotel is very basic, but clean. Encountered no major problems though for €120 a night I would have expected something a little more modern. For example this hotel actually uses keys, not key cards. It's close to the metro so a good location to get around. Avenue Parallel isnt the most glamorous of areas of Barcelona so exercise some caution if you are out about at night.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, reasonably located.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: While some of the reviews found issues with the Parallel, we found our stay here to be quite reasonable, and the staff helpful (though their English was variable from very good to a bit limited). Probaly the two biggest dislikes were the parking (which is across the street) is expensive (24 Euros/day), and they need to provide better instructions on how to get to their property, e.g., from the airport. (Take the train to Sants, switch to the subway.., though I forget which one, but it is obvious as you just go to the Parallel metro stop, or there is a direct bus: which they say "take a bus", but provide no bus number. Providing the details would help A LOT!!!) On the plus side, the rooms were quite comfortable (even for three), as noted above the staff is quite helpful, and it is very well located. While it is not in the historical district, that is only a few short blocks away. The subway is two blocks away. The fruit market is a 5-10 minute walk. Getting to the beach takes 20 minutes. Reasonable resataurants are around. The train station is 10 minutes. For breakfast, there are some quite reasonable cafe's within a block that serve a solid breakfast. At night, the cafe's on the street behind the hotel is very popular with the locals, but if you do not get there by 10:30 pm (or so), it will be difficult to find a table outside.

Reviews.Title: “To Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Raquel19
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed 2 nights there. Employees at front desk were very friendly and helpful. The room was ok...nothing to remember. The worst part of our stay was all the screaming and shouting we heard during the 2 days of our stay....specially because it woke us up several times. The breakfast service was better than what we expected...so we would recomende it. If you need a good hotel, in a good area and from this chain, I would recommend U232.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: jenser
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Parell with my mum for a few days before christmas last year. I was delighted with the value of the hotel and I wasn't disappointed with anything while we were there. The rooms were clean and tidy and although the hotel is close to the centre of Barcelona (about 10-15 minute walk) it is slightly off the main street which makes it a little bit quieter than any of the hotels on the main streets. The staff were very friendly and the free internet usage in the lobby was helpful for checking our flights before we left for the airport. A nice, clean and tidy budget hotel that I would recommend for a variety of travellers

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but clean”
Reviews.Author: danielkegel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend with my dad, brother and brother-in-law. We didn't really care about the hotel as long as it was cheap, clean, had single beds and was close to the city center. The hotel Paral-lel meets these requirements but nothing more than that. The rooms are very small, the beds rock-hard and the bathrooms look worn down. It was clean though and everything (tv, lights, shower) worked. There is no form of luxury whatsoever, so if you're looking to rest or have a romantic weekend, go elsewhere. Also the walls are pretty thin, you can hear most of the things your neighbours say. The airconditioning wasn't working (hot air only) so it got very warm in the room. We couldn't leave the windows open because of the noise of the Av. del Paral-lel nearby. With the windows closed the noise is bearable, it didn't bother us during the night. Breakfast was OK, nothing fancy but enough of everything. TV has only one English channel (SkyTV), the rest is Spanish and Catalan. The hotel is close to public transport (Paral-lel station just 200 meters away) and there are ATM's, bars and fastfood-restaurants around the corner. So a good hotel if you're out with friends and only use the hotel for sleeping, but I would'nt recommend it for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great...”
Reviews.Author: Newlyweds07-06
Reviews.Content: The way people rave about this hotel as being somewhat of a "diamond in the rough" my expectations were high. However, this hotel is as basic as they come in an "off the beaten path" non-touristy neighborhood. The only thing I will leave here liking is the price. The beds are hard as rocks and the bathroom looks out of the 1970s. Only one channel in English on the TV, too. The worst part by far is the paper thin walls. We could hear the people in the room next to ours clear conversations all through the night, on a weeknight at 3am. A call to reception did nothing. Additionally, I second the reviewer who said the front desk staff were lacking personalities. I know it's a 2 star hotel but I couldn't even get one of them to call our tour company to confirm our Montserrat tour the next day. He just pointed to a payphone and even as I returned several times to ask questions on how to dial from inside the city, etc. he had no answers. I got another staffer to agree to make the call for me later that day, I left all my info with him and he would "call the room later today." Yeah, we never got that call. Overall, this place is ok for a quick break as long as you know you're getting no frills at all. From the view out our window at the apartment block next door's laundry and into their kitchens to the crusty bidet in the bathroom, it's not at all glamorous. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “City of Pick Pockets”
Reviews.Author: JoeMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, room cleaned daily, no facilities though. Reception staff came across as if they were about to be shot at dawn....... No personallities. Got robbed on my first day and when they were told they acted as if they didn't give a toss.

Reviews.Title: “FAB for Barcelona on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: LondonBarbie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend on a 3 night break. We got a ridiculously cheap deal - less than £30 per night for a double room, and were a bit apprehensive about staying in a 2-star hotel. However, it was a fantastic experience! Nice modern decor, spotlessly clean, good bath and shower, and although not huge, not cramped in the slightest. The mirrored wardrobe covering one entire wall of the room was a little disturbing at first, but fab for getting ready and for, um, romantic getaways!! The staff were very friendly, and it's in a great location, a stone's throw from the metro and not far from any of the main attractions of the city - in fact, we walked everywhere at night to avoid paying for taxis after the metro shut! Mini-bar is also a nice touch. Only problem we had was the fact that our 'double bed' was actually 2 singles pushed together, and they didn't always stay together! Apparently this is pretty standard practice on the continent though? Overall an Excellent choice if you're doing Barcelona on a budget. With Easyjet flights we had a 4 day break for £150 each.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: ExpatGermany
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception were extremely friendly at all times and spoke excellent English. For various reasons I had 3 rooms in the 4 nights I stayed there. The room on the 1st floor looking to the street was rather loud, not only because of traffic but because of a shop downstairs playing music all day until 20:30. The rooms facing the back of the building are quiet. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are extremely clean and functional, and there are even toiletries in the bathroom, but no hair drier. In the lobby you can use the internet free of charge for up to 30 minutes. We found it to be a good location, as there is a Metro station just a few metres away, and the walk to the port and to the Ramblas area is only about 10 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel, but would make sure I get a quiet room next time.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HolliDayKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Para.lel hotel at the beginning of October for a long weekend. We found the hotel to be of a good standard for a 2 star hotel. Rooms were very clean and towels were changed every day, you also had a free safe in the room. Breakfast was very good with lots of choices. We found the reception staff very helpful. Our room was a bit on the small side but as we were out and about all day, didn't really bother us. The cleanliness of the room was excellant. We would definately stay here again. Area is a bit run down but didn't feel threatened in anyway. On our last day we left our bags and went off for the day, however on the way back the heavens opened and we were soaked, the guy on reception went off to fetch us some towels, also phoned us a taxi, as we had already checked out this extra service was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ConfusedCJ
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about going to this hotel. Some of the reviews I'd read and pictures I saw made me think it would be ok but others weren't so good and I was still worried. I need not have been. Yes, it's not the four star hotel that I would normally look to stay in for a week or more's holiday, but it more than deserves it's two stars, to be honest, I would happily give it three. Arrival and check in was quick and painless, the reception staff were very efficient and spoke good English - particular thanks to Fran who was a very helpful young man indeed. We found our room to be very pleasant indeed, sadly it smelt of smoke but it wasn't bad enough for us to feel that we needed to switch rooms. Yes there were small things that some travellers might have taken photos of and posted on here, a bit of plaster missing from the corner of the concrete post in between the beds for instance, but frankly, for a two star hotel, it was more than adequate. The rooms were exceptionally clean and had everything we needed for a weekend - no tea/coffee making facilities but there was a mini-bar if you don't mind paying mini-bar prices. There were even toiletries in the bathroom which I'm not sure you'd expect to find in a two star property? There was a safe in the spacious wardrobe. Beds and pillows were very comfortable indeed and the rooms had air conditioning. I'd read some reviews that said this hotel wasn't in a very good location for eating out. Well, it is in easy walking distance of everything I can think you'd need. An easy 10 minutes to the Bus Turistic stop by the marina for instance, 10 minutes to La Rambla and about 20 to 30 minutes to the fountains (yes we walked it there and back!). There are places to eat within a couple of minutes walk and we felt safe even when we were walking around late at night (two female travellers!). It's a great place to stay if you wish to visit the two theatres in Ave Parallel as they're only about 5 mins max walk. The breakfast room seemed a lot smaller than I'd expected but was never more than half full and served a very acceptable continental style breakfast. There's not a bar in the hotel but there is a luggage room if you need it - which we did! I couldn't fault the hotel or it's staff and I would definitely consider staying there again should I return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alex70Athens
Reviews.Content: good hotel, clean rooms, i had a room on the main street on the 1st floor it was bit noisy but i didn't mind about. helpfull staff speaking english

Reviews.Title: “location,location ,location”
Reviews.Author: celtictiger_7
Reviews.Content: I will certainly be staying in this hotel again. As a woman travelling on her own, i found it so easy to find with the directions on the hotel web site. The hotel was spotlessly clean, plenty of towels soap shower gel shampoo, tissues, even shoe cleaning materials. You could order meals to your room if you so choose.I did not use the bar in the room but it was an added bonus if you needed anything. Staff were very frindly and could speak english. I did not even have to ask for my room key, the young gentleman who booked me in automatically knew me and handed me my key. He had long dark hair, and always seem to be smiling, lovely guy. Metro station was circa 100yds away, and was so handy for going into the main tourist area. There was a lovely little square to sit in ajacent to the hotel where you could sit and do some people watching. I left the hotel in the morning and did not go back to it until midnight, so it suited my needs, which were (somewhere to sleep) My whole expereince was wonderful and I would recommend this hotel to anyown, and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Bad staff !! Poor service !!!”
Reviews.Author: MoeKuwait
Reviews.Content: JUST DON`T STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!! bad customer service .. and when i booked for a twin bed room .. they gave me three beds in double room and the place was full of bed and even we cant walk or open our bags ... the air condition was totally out of order you just can hear the sound of AC... the most terrible thing is the bad staff and poor service quality ..!! but the rooms clean and the location good at least near to the Ramblas street ...!!

Reviews.Title: “basic in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bournemouthnextyear
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my extended family. Rooms are basic but clean and the hotel represents reasonable value for money. The area the hotel is in is a bit 'down at heel' but it is convenient for sightseeing. I would however have felt uncomfortable coming back to the hotel alone after dark. My only gripe is the hotel's reception staff who were a touch on the rude side for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: sydruth
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and the location was ideal. We were able to walk to most attractions but the metro was also close by and easy to use. The staff were friendly and the room was very clean. We consider this hotel great value for money and a good base for exploring Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, central and decent 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_and_Timmy
Reviews.Content: Definitely a clean, affordable, central and decent 2 star hotel for Barcelona. The metro is a 2 minute walk away and La Rambla a 10 minute walk away. The rooms are clean, basic, with satellite TV and a free safe (which we ended up forgetting our code and had to get reception to open it up for us, very efficient). The rooms get cleaned and towels changed everyday, even if you don't put the "make my room" sign up outside your door. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, speaking English, Italian, German... you name the language! The breakfast is good with good coffee, cakes, cereal and yogurts. I have only 3 negative things to say: 1) You don't have double beds, but rather two single beds placed side by side (a shame when you're sharing with your loved one!). 2) The walls are thin and you can hear the noises from the room next door clearly. 3) The area has a slight “outskirts” feel, with few people around and a bit dirty (but within a few minutes walk you’re in a decent area). Generally though a very good hotel for the 2 stars and for its location. I’d definitely recommend it to my own friends.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Maria&Mike
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in this clean, simple hotel in April. The hotel Paral.lel is part of the Nunez Narrvao hotel chain, of which it is one of their mid-range budget places to stay. The rooms were spacious and very clean with satellite TV, a mini-bar and safe. Breakfast and room service were available at an extra cost, but we decided to eat out for breakfast at local cafes. The staff spoke English well (if your Spanish is not that good!) and were very friendly and helpful. Good location - 5 min walk from Paral.lel Metro (which is then a 10 min ride to La Rambla) and the funicular which takes you up to the hill. Also, a fantastic restaurant nearby called Elche. All in all, highly recommend this hotel if you're ok with no frills, a good price and good location just outside of the main centre. Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Paral.lel
HotelInfo.Address: 5-7 Poeta Cabanyes, 08004 Barcelona, Spain
